Name: Silver Fox Trail
Address: 11601 Saskatchewan Dr NW, Edmonton, AB T6G 2B5
Description: Beautiful gravel trail for walking/biking along the river! Connects to the main river valley trail system.

Name: Emily Murphy Park
Address: 11904 Emily Murphy Park Road NW, Edmonton, Alberta
Description: A popular riverside park with picnic sites, a boat launch, and access to the river valley trail system.

Name: Buena Vista Park
Description: Nature trails, picnic sites & a popular off-leash dog park on the North Saskatchewan River.

Name: Queen Elizabeth Park
Address: 10380 Queen Elizabeth Park Road , Edmonton, Alberta
Description: Great paved trail for biking along the river, picnic sites

Name: Muttart conservatory
Description: Botanical gardens housed in iconic glass pyramids, each with a different climate and plant life (temperate, arid, tropical).

Name: Whitemud Park
Description: Trails for walking and running along the Whitemud Creek & picnic areas.

Name: Fort Edmonton Park
Description: A living history museum, with a re-created historical fort, streets from different eras, a steam train, and more.

Name: Elk Island National Park
Description: This National Park is just 35 minutes east of Edmonton. The prairie plateau is home to the largest population of hoofed mammals in all of Canada. These include bison, elk, moose, mule deer, and white-tailed deer. There is no denser population anywhere in the country.

Name: University of Alberta Botanic Garden
Description: A stunning 240-acre garden (including a Japanese garden).
